comments.body: Yes, like /gamerule itemDespawn <Ticks> or <t:Seconds>
Is this in the right category?
I feel this show be a gamerule option, just like entity cramming. Input would be an integer indicating the number of minutes with 0 being no despawn.

Love this idea, so many people could benefit from this. The default predictable limits of computer performance aren't applicable to everyone's computers, so some people need entities to despawn faster or longer depending on their situations. Redstone pros might want to minimize lag and want entity despawn to be faster (or maybe they want it to be longer depending on what they are trying to make) and survival players definitely want entity despawn to take way longer in order to give us time to find our stuff again, instead of having to race to the chunk and set render distance to 2 on the way to the death location just to make sure we can get as much time as possible to relocate our stuff while we are actually in the chunk. 

I think that as well as frequently used options like you said like 1-10 or 30 minutes, the player should be able to enter a time length of how long they want items to be there (Maybe they want it to be an hour, or even 2? what if you died on an amplified world and half of your stuff fell on the top of the cliff and the rest at the bottom of a super long fall? that would require a lot of time to retrieve!). This is a variable that could definitely easily be adjusted and I think we should have the ability to change it in order to ensure the best out of gameplay.

This is the 3rd time in one day that I have lost extremely important items that have despawned right in front of me because it took me 5mins and about 2secs to find my inventory. So I keep find my thing just to see ALL my hard work vanish as I arrive. Like dude come on, its an infn world, really!
I agree with this statement i lost all my diamonds and im usally the farmer meanig i never mine so i am upset pls fix this asap
What would clicking the text do?
Uh, this is not the place for this. The clickable text on java is only really accessible through commands. It's not a UI feature
Usernames in chat are clickable, as well as screenshot messages, etc

Here a command: /tellraw <Player> {"text":"<Message>","clickEvent":{"action":"run_command","value":"<Command>"}} Example: /tellraw @s {"text":"Say hello to everyone!","clickEvent":{"action":"run_command","value":"/say  Hello!"},"hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","value":"Command: /say Hello!"}} to Java Edition, I don't play Bedrock
Awesome idea! I agree.

What we need is a virtual "shift" button. When you click on a stack while pressing shift, it moves the whole stack to either the inventory (from hotbar), to the end of the inventory (from inventory which works in chests, furnaces, crafting tables, etc) and to the chests, furnaces, crafting tables, etc (from the inventory)

 

We also need to be able to swap tapping and holding to "left click" so that we can tap and hold to "right click".
The Pocket UI should also be added to Java.

This is a good idea. Clouds are purely cosmetic, so having a slider for them won't be game-breaking at all, and would allow for a lot more flexibility with builds. After all, you can totally disable clouds in the visual settings. I think that (post-1.18) the slider should range from Y-levels 64 to 320, with the default height being 192 or something close to that.
Yes... But imagine looking down from one of those new mountains, and you see the cloud-wrapped world beneath you, and you feel like it's an entirely different world...

I think it should be in the dimension type folder

Edit: It is now

This is what we've needed for a long time. I was really annoyed when they changed the cloud height for 2 reasons:

1) I built a structure whose aesthetic was dependent on the clouds being present at that specific level.

2) I built a different structure that I deliberately put above cloud level.

And now I have two problems, as the cloud height is no longer where I need it for the first structure, and now the cloud height is directly in the way of the structure I intended to build above it, specifically with clouds interfering with my primary operating layer. We are talking tens of thousands of blocks of walkable space, now entirely obstructed by a cloud height change I didn't ask for.

Considering clouds are purely aesthetic, there's no reason not to have an adjustable cloud height option.

@UltraRangerZer0 some of my Nintendo friends does not have a Microsoft account. They cannot use the invite game option without a Microsoft account. I want this feature for non-Microsoft account players.

This would also allow Nintendo friends to be invite-only like Microsoft ones. There's no way to keep Nintendo friends off of a world if you don't want them at the moment, which is very annoying. Please add this Mojang!!
PLEASE!!!!

2 years later, still broken.

VR controls for Oculus used to be better, but it seems at some point some "genius" decided that the Oculus controllers should be mapped exactly like an XBox controller. This results in off-hand controls doing things that the main hand is pointing at (e.g. placing blocks, using items) while main-hand buttons do things on the off-hand (change selected item). It's very unintuitive and I keep pressing the wrong buttons.

Please, being able to re-map the controls would completely solve this issue!!!!!

Would love to have Auto Jump on WMR. Option for VR mode feels lacking.

Overall to able to actually manually map inputs would help in the long run.

I don't like clicking on the sticks as I would fear it might make the stick not usable from drafting issue.

Some servers have "global" or "local" types of chat systems, but, again, That is dependent on the server, the version they are running, and if they even care to do so.

A built in bubble system would be great!

Minecraft's current chat makes you look at a UI at the bottom left corner which in my opinion is unnatural and not immersive. Chat bubbles would make it just a bit better so I agree with this.

The usual chat UI should be reserved for commands and messages you sent and should disappear later instead of scrolling upwards.

Options for "Chat bubbles only" and "Hide chat bubbles" would be nice too.
There should be a toggle setting on this chat bubble feature. It could affect the game's performance or you dont just like it

I agree that this should be a toggle setting.
I also think it should either be an accessibility slider or a game-rule for how close you need to be for it to show up.

This would make anybody's life easier. A built-in server browser would be great for finding worldwide internet games, just like in the days of Halo, Counter-Strike, etc.
GREAT IDEA!
But you couldn't just put any server in there. What if it is not moderated!
It could have a popular, featured, high rated, up and coming servers and then also stuff like survival, minigames or factions etc.

Such a list should be searchable by tags (e.g. Minigames, Survival, or Modded), Player count, Name, or other factors. Being on this server browser should not require a partnership like in Bedrock, and should only require a Server be registered with mojang on a website.

This feature has been implemented in many of Valve's games (source engine). I think it would be a great addition to Minecraft.
Not only does it help players to find servers locally/globally easier, but it also reduces many of the bad practices of server listing websites. It would also help many smaller servers, or public servers to get their name out there without having to pay these listing websites.
Regarding moderation, now that we have chat report, servers which have enforce-secure-profile=false or intentionally disabling chat report should not be listed.
Moved to proper category.Thanks for your contribution.
